image.altText: A woman places crosses in front of Geraldton Courthouse on the first day of the inquest into the death of JC.

props.synopsis: A policewoman who saw a fellow officer fatally shoot an Aboriginal woman with known mental health issues tells a coronial inquiry additional training was unlikely to have prevented the victim's death.

title.children: Cultural, mental health training unlikely to have prevented fatal shooting of Aboriginal woman, inquiry told

image.altText: A composite image showing the logos of ANZ, NAB, CBA and Westpac banks.

props.synopsis: With banks under near-constant attack from malicious actors trying to access everything from money to personal information, Australia's major banks are ramping up cyber security and urging customers to be more educated about scams.

title.children: Major bank raises alarm bell on cyber 'warfare', claims 'entire community is at risk'

image.altText: A skyline view of Gaza showing two white phosphorus bombs exploding in the distance.

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation into superannuation funds offering members "ethical" or "socially aware" options unearths millions of dollars of retirement savings invested in companies that make some of the most controversial and devastating weapons of war.

title.children: 'Totally immoral' weapons found in share holdings of Australian ethical super funds

image.altText: A woman wearing a hijab looks at her phone.

props.synopsis: A new political organisation plans to unseat Labor MPs in a 'teal-style' campaign capitalising on Muslim community anger over the government's Gaza stance.

title.children: 'Teal-style' Muslim political group to target Labor seats, open to working with Fatima Payman

image.altText: A woman wearing a pale grey jacket and hijab, and glasses.

props.synopsis: Suspended Labor senator Fatima Payman to sit out of all Senate votes as she accuses colleagues of seeking to intimidate her to quit politics. Look back at how the day unfolded in our live blog.

title.children: 'I have been exiled': Fatima Payman accuses Labor colleagues of attempting to intimidate her to resign from Senate — as it happened

image.altText: Three men at sea on a catamaran that has been damaged.

props.synopsis: The crew set off a distress beacon after running aground off the state's rugged south coast.

title.children: Trio winched to safety after catamaran hits rocks off WA coast

image.altText: A person holds onto some money.

props.synopsis: While we may have heard about these laws in the past, they don't take effect until today.

title.children: A number of new laws come into effect today. See how they could affect you

image.altText: People sitting on a rock surface at night. A helicopter hovers above and shines a light down.

props.synopsis: Travellers near Bell Gorge in the Kimberley say they heard the woman's leg break followed by screaming. An ABC journalist, a nurse and a retired GP were among those who rushed to her aid.

title.children: ABC journo, retired GP and nurse rush to help woman after bone-breaking fall at WA gorge

image.altText: Demotion vehicles pull down building

props.synopsis: Extreme coastal erosion, a visiting Chinese premier and an award-winning chef's stint in a northern pub — these are WA's top photos of the month for June.

title.children: The cream of the crop in another month of stunning photo opportunities around Western Australia

image.altText: Three students in black graduation gowns.

props.synopsis: The Australian government is doubling the cost of student visa fees for international students, prompting outrage from student representatives who say that the price hike will drive potential students to competitors.

title.children: Visa fees for international students double, sparking outrage

image.altText: A plume of smoke and fire rises from a hillside where a rocket fell and detonated.

props.synopsis: What began as a static test of a new "Sky Dragon 3" rocket by a private Chinese space company ended in a fiery explosion following the rocket's accidental launch.

title.children: Chinese Space Pioneer's Sky Dragon 3 rocket detonates following accidental launch

image.altText: A white plane with the word "Boeing" and the markings "737", "MAX", and "8" on its wings.

props.synopsis: The US Department of Justice (DOJ) is reportedly hitting the plane maker with a criminal fraud charge over two fatal plane crashes in 2018 and 2019.

title.children: Boeing is being charged with fraud over two fatal plane crashes. Reports say they've been offered a deal

image.altText: The silhouette of a woman leaning and holding a child.

props.synopsis: Legal and social groups say housing shortages and diminished services mean the child protection system is failing the people it is meant to protect.

title.children: Advocates say child protection 'destroys families and communities' in northern WA with system built to fail

image.altText: Man sitting on couch with yellow case

props.synopsis: After receiving Margaret River's first purpose-built shark attack response kit, Keith Halnan wonders why there aren't more similar aids across WA's beaches.

title.children: Push to get more shark attack kits rolled out across WA beaches

image.altText: Timber crates in thawed, refrozen lake

props.synopsis: Wilkes Station in Antarctica has been abandoned since 1969. The site, with its old fuel drums, asbestos buildings and other waste, has been described by a French inspection team as "concerning" to the local environment.

title.children: 'It was truly abandoned': Decommissioned Antarctic base a pollution risk as French team calls on Australia to clean up

image.altText: a house with solar panels on the roof

props.synopsis: Australians being wrenched into the teeth of the energy transition can expect more change from today amid new prices, solar charges and government largesse.

title.children: New prices, solar charges, and government support all mean your power bill will be changing today

image.altText: Two old man's hands resting on a computer.

props.synopsis: Scammers posing as investment experts are grooming victims over the phone for weeks to gain their trust, before stealing their money.

title.children: Robert spent weeks on the phone talking to a 'financial advisor' in a scam that cost him thousands

image.altText: US gymnast Simone Biles holds up her phone and smiles as streamers fall at the national Olympic trials.

props.synopsis: After a difficult Tokyo campaign, gymnastics legend Simone Biles will return to the Olympic stage in Paris, aiming to add to her four gold medals from Rio.

title.children: 'I knew I wasn't done': Gymnastics legend Simone Biles bound for third Olympics after dominating US trials

image.altText: A middle-aged blonde woman in a suit laughs while speaking to reporters.

props.synopsis: The results indicate Emmanuel Macron's decision to call the snap poll appear to have backfired, with France now the closest it has been to having a far-right government since World War II.

title.children: Marine Le Pen's far-right National Rally officially wins first round of French parliamentary elections

image.altText: A black and white photo of a women's soccer team wearing an Australian uniform

props.synopsis: In 1975, a women's club team represented Australia in the first Women's Asian Cup in Hong Kong, but they've never been acknowledged as official Matildas. Until now.

title.children: Are these the 'First Matildas?' Football Australia rewrites history with 1975 caps

image.altText: Jill Clarke stands in front of three glasses of water with pink vapes inside.

props.synopsis: Jill's vaping dependence and attempts to quit became a social media journey followed by millions. Here's what she thinks about the changes to Australia's vaping laws.

title.children: Millions watched as Jill tried to quit vaping. Then something unexpected happened

image.altText: A portrait of a blonde-haired woman wearing a pink button-up shirt.

props.synopsis: A report has found Hobart City Council staff breached anti-discrimination laws by lying to councillor Louise Elliot about the availability of a venue for a planned event about "the impact" of transwomen in women's sports.

title.children: Councillor opposed to transgender rights to receive apology after being 'lied to' over venue booking

image.altText: Kayak cross athlete Noemie Fox has her paddle lifted over her head at the end of the race with a look of sheer joy and relief.

props.synopsis: Noemie Fox has commanded the spotlight for herself, as she joins her parents and sister as an Olympian, being officially selected in the kayak cross for the Paris Olympics.

title.children: No longer blocked by her GOAT sister, Noemie Fox becomes the fourth Olympian in her family

image.altText: Muddy tyre tracks coming off a highway.

props.synopsis: Police say initial investigations into a fatal bus crash in north Queensland show the Greyhound bus travelled onto the wrong side of the road before colliding with a four-wheel drive towing a caravan.

title.children: Initial investigations show Greyhound bus travelled on wrong side of road before fatal collision, police say

image.altText: A screenshot of Louis Tomlinson alongside footage of his campsite Euros watch party.

props.synopsis: From One Direction's Louis Tomlinson saving the day for football fans to Avril Lavigne clearing out the main stage, here's what you might have missed from the final day of this year's Glastonbury Festival.

title.children: 'Man of the people' Louis Tomlinson smuggles TV into Glastonbury camp

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: The ASX 200 closed down 0.2 per cent after battling back from a sharp fall on opening.  Look back at how the day unfolded on our live markets blog.

title.children: ASX closes down 0.2% after clawing back heavy early losses — as it happened

image.altText: Two younger women, an older man and an older woman walking in front of a helicopter with a security guard in the background.

props.synopsis: Top US Democrats rule out the possibility of replacing President Joe Biden as the Democratic nominee after a feeble debate performance.

title.children: Biden family, top Democrats back president amid calls for him to quit 2024 race

image.altText: A poster with French writing on it and the pictures of a woman and a man smiling.

props.synopsis: After the first round of snap parliamentary elections, France is the closest it has been to having a far-right government since World War II. So, what does this all mean for France? How does it work? And will President Macron stay in power?

title.children: France's snap election: Why is it happening, who are the National Rally, and what's happening to Macron?

image.altText: A yellow sale sign advertising a newly built house is on the market.

props.synopsis: An expert panel of top economic forecasters expects the Reserve Bank to cut interest rates two to three times over the next 18 months, with the first cut likely in March.

title.children: What Australia's economy will look like in a year, according to 29 top forecasters

image.altText: ASX in Sydney

props.synopsis: Happy financial new year! Look back at the year that was in financial markets; which stocks performed best, what tanked and where analysts are focusing their attention over the coming 12 months.

title.children: Stocks that shot to the Moon, and companies that tanked: Our end of financial year review

image.altText: Orpheus Pledger running his hand through his hair with denim jacket over his shoulder.

props.synopsis: The Melbourne Magistrates' Court heard Orpheus Pledger's victim had bruises on her face and signs of strangulation.

title.children: Former Home and Away star pleads guilty to violent attack on woman

image.altText: Wayne Butcher looking at camera

props.synopsis: Cape York mayor Wayne Butcher has been charged with multiple offences including strangulation and grievous bodily harm.

title.children: Queensland mayor arrested over multiple alleged domestic violence offences

image.altText: A man holding a bike helmet under his arm

props.synopsis: By allowing cyclists to ride in the centre of the road, Toowoomba's Pierce Street is changing conversations around transport and urban planning.

title.children: What happens when you give cyclists more rights on the road? This city is finding out

image.altText: Mum doing downward dog yoga pose in lounge room with a young boy playing underneath her.

props.synopsis: As family demands increase, women's physical activity becomes more limited, but the same doesn't happen for men.

title.children: Men 'borrowing' free time from women is driving the gender exercise gap
